website_summaries.verdict: Versatile all-purpose boxing gloves with a tight fit design. Offer solid comfort in sparring and practice conditions.
pros: Great for training and various contact sport styles from shadowboxing to sparring or pad work
Build quality stands up to heavy use
cons: Might be too tight around the knuckles for some users

customer_reviews.title: Hold up with regular use
customer_reviews.text: I am 170 lbs and used the 18 oz gloves for a little over 3 yrs. with heavy bag work and kick boxing 2-3 times a week. They are just now showing slight wear in the inside padding where in the pinky finger area. The outside of each glove has held up excellent. Real leather is worth the cost. These gloves are a worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Moorman

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Gloves for Pad Work
customer_reviews.text: I've decided to go with 10oz gloves for pad/heavy bag use. There is enough padding to protect my knuckles. I started off with the 16oz, which wasn't bad at all. I made the switch so I could work on hand speed. The stitching is done well. The leather is high quality. Fairtex makes high quality products with genuine leather. Love these gloves
customer_reviews.author: Maurice F

customer_reviews.title: They are great but they could be better
customer_reviews.text: They fit well, I am a big guy with big hands, the design is awesome, the material feels great, the only problem i have with them is the lack of better wrist support, I bought the 16oz. and the wrists feel too loose, so if you are a heavy hitter and want them for punching bag i would not get them, for sparring they are alright, the weight of padding is distributed more all over the glove so the knuckles are not too padded, which is not bad, but FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Always right

customer_reviews.title: Love it. The only thing is - I am ...
customer_reviews.text: Asked a few different coaches and made decision to buy this one. Love it. The only thing is - I am not so sure if 12oz is right for me. Coach said they would work fine with me but I personally find myself more comfortable to train with heavier gloves. But I decided to keep them and start training with the 12oz gloves I bought anyway as coach himself has 12oz training gloves too (he's like 170lbs) My data FYR - 5'4" female.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: Love them and the color is true
customer_reviews.text: My 14 YO Daughter loves Muay Thai, she asked for new gloves for Christmas. Talked with others at her gym and they all recomended this brand. Talked to her master and he told me that 16oz would be heavy for her but she would be able to grow with them and she was strong only getting stronger. She loves the feel and though they do wear her out but she is getting use to them and getting stronger. we also bought her:to help keep them smelling fresher.
customer_reviews.author: Madphule

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate picture and description
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and expected the 12 oz. BGV1 gloves, and received the BGV1 “breathable” gloves (there is a difference). The picture and description show BGV1 model, with leather all around. The model I received has a nylon mesh on the palm. Had I know this, I wouldn’t have ordered. These are quite smaller than my Twins 12 oz. The leather looks cheap, and not like some of the pictures I’ve seen.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: My favorite gloves
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these after starting out with hayabusa gloves (still awesome gloves, but the double strap isn't for me and despite my constant cleaning and best efforts they still seem to stink up rather quickly). It took a couple of months to break in the wrist enough for me to get them to fit snug (I'm 5'3" and have baby hands), but I have no complaints. These have held up really well and are my go-to for training. Also, I'm shallow and love the designs and color options. Definitely recommend these, and think they're well worth the price if you train regularly! Ordered 12 oz, and they fit well with wraps. Hand is approx. 6"-7" from wrist to middle finger.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth G.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment now than buying crappy cheap ones today, even if you don't box very often. (but you should!)
customer_reviews.text: I cannot rave enough about how much I love these gloves. They are the coolest looking gloves in my favorite color and it is an incredible UPGRADE from the crappy everlast I've been using for a year. It is excelled for sparring, bags, conditioning etc. It is such high quality that I needed quite a few conditioning rounds and thickened wraps to break them in. The velcro straps are extremely sticky so sometimes it's difficult when I already have a glove on one hand because it goes all the way around your wrist. My left is just a tiny bit more loose than my right hand and I'm okay with that. I absolutely love these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves—Just not for small hands with short fingers!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the padding and workmanship on these gloves, but they were huge on my hands (I have a 7 1/2 inch palm circumference and 6 3/8 inch finger length from longest fingertip to base of palm). I normally use 14 oz. gloves, so that is what I ordered. I was, so disappointed, since I know others who have Fairtex gloves and I've witnessed their durability. However, the hand compartment swallowed my hand; with my thumb seated, my fingers barely started the curl of the glove, and the cuff came up really high on my arm. Would love to see them make an actual women's glove; I'd definitely give them a try!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Wiens

customer_reviews.title: Apollo Creed in the House
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are f*****g awesome. I train Muay Thai regularly and I feel much more confident/secure when throwing harder punches with these gloves on. They're compact, tight, and I love doing padwork with them. I've yet to spar with them (going to use my beater Venums until the proverbial tires fall off). But all around solid bu nonetheless! Be warned: Everyone in my gym calls me "Apollo" now (reference to Apollo Creed). Lmao You're going to get attention, but that's part of being an American Gangster. 8]
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: High Quality and Durable Gloves from a Reliable Brand
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are perfect for what I need. I'm just using them for bag work for the time being with things shutdown. With that said I've tried a few pairs of cheap gloves and a few well known brands. These fairtex gloves are quality, and very reputable. The value for the price is great, and they seem like they will last years whereas I've had other gloves fall apart on me in months. Will update this review if they start breaking down too quickly, but I doubt they will! To mention, I've only ever trained muay thai, so for my style and experience I wanted a glove from a well known muay thai brand. These are absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy seckinger

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, awesome gloves. Fairtex is known for making pretty good gear, and these gloves live up to that expectation. I have used them for regular practice for over a year without any noticeable loss of padding or wearing out. They're nice, thick leather, with good wrist support and they're suitable for bag work, pad work, and sparring. I had several pairs of cheaper gloves, in the $20 range and they would all wear out within a year or so. These are the best gloves I've bought and have already lasted longer than any other pair. The quality is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anna R.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So I have had these gloves for just over a year and a half. I kickbox a good amount of time and use these often to do big glove sparring for MMA. They give me a good feeling. They are real tight, but provide good comfort. The inside has help up and only now do I see signs that these are close to breaking down. These feel like real boxing gloves and not some of the fit box gloves I have used to train in the past. These gloves could probably make it to two years before I replace them. You get what you pay for and these were worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: I've trained in boxing and MMA for over 6 years and these are the best fitting/feeling gloves I've ever owned. Delivery was faster than expected as well. Highly recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Diaz

customer_reviews.title: FAKE DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: THESE GLOVES ARE FAKE. I have authentic fairtex gloves and these are fake. I bought my first pair, and had to have Amazon force exchange them because the seller would not return them. The ripped and we're fading prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: Rio

customer_reviews.title: Very unforgiving gloves that punish hands
customer_reviews.text: I found these gloves to be unnecessarily tough with limited padding that felt like hard plastic on my hands. I have been wearing wraps and still busting my knuckles raw every time I wear them. May be they work for light punching but they do not conform to hand and hurt my thumbs after about 2 months of use. I hate wearing them and DO NOT recommend them to anyone. I am giving 2 stars because they seem well made but the material quality is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FAKE! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: SO FAKE! Smelled terrible as soon as I opened package. And compared with the other pair I own. Obviously fake!!!!!! STAY AWAY!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: It's not a bad glove. Aesthetically
customer_reviews.text: It's not a bad glove. Aesthetically, I actually really like the gloves, but the feel is really different from a regular boxing glove. I heard so many good things about Fairtex, so I thought I'd give it a try; they aren't bad gloves, but I can really feel the impact on my fists when hitting a heavy bag. I have no doubt that these could outlast any other glove I've bought, but because of the stiffness, flatness of the face, and the slipping, it just doesn't feel right. Unless you're heavily invested in clinching, I feel like traditional boxing gloves are far better for bagwork, sparring, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tam Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to order these gloves they were supposed to be well-made and very Durable they arrive on 8 May and on the 20th they already started wearing very disappointed on the brand because they are known to have quality stuff and these gloves were 80 bucks I seen gloves for 40 and better quality not the gloves if you are Training kickboxing or boxing these are not the gloves for you it will rip easily Not worth the money unfortunately
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat Fairtex
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd set of gloves I've purchased from Fairtex in the last 30 years with consistent use. The only reason I got rid of my last pair is that I was living in home with a lot of mold and my doctor told me to get rid of everything. These gloves are extremely durable and will last many years with rugged use. Well worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Poor Fit for Small Frame Female
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very nice. Good stitching and great quality. However, the fit was not good for me. I am female, 5'4", 125 lbs with small frame and small hands. Even with wraps the hand pocket on the 14 ounce gloves was way to large. The glove slipped around on my hand/wrist. Also, the area for the wrist does not tighten up well on a small frame.
customer_reviews.author: mprin

customer_reviews.title: Top choice for sure!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit so well I can’t wait to spar tomorrow. I have had the open thumb 10oz bag gloves for almost 20 years and just replaced them with new ones for bag work and they are still the same quality from what I can tell. They are looser than my ringsides so my hand is more comfortable with wraps. My hands were hurting and very hot. They are the 16oz and I’m 6,1 190lbs typically I wear a large in any type of gloves. You won’t regret choosing these! I have never been disappointed with any of their gloves. But you will be upset buying some of the other brands for sure, I have.
customer_reviews.author: stark on the beltline

customer_reviews.title: Impressive value and well made
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased to report that these gloves are of top construction and well padded. I use them mainly for bag workout and light sparring. They can also be used for competition without any issues. The gloves fit tight, have a comfortable feel and have smooth insides with no abrasive parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: genuine Fairtex universal bgv-1
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned these might be a Fugazi, but they appear to be authentic when i put them side by side with my Fairtex gloves I ordered from Fairtex website. I've only had them for a couple weeks so I can't comment on their durability. Remember the bgv-1 doesn't have a grip bar so the fist can be a little roomy especially w/o handwraps.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gloves
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality gloves. I used revgear gloves before these and I will never go back. They take a little time to break in but once they've done so, they're perfect. I wipe mine out after every use with anti bacterial wipes and let them air dry for a bit before using glove dogs and they've never had an odor. If you take care of them, they'll take care of your hands!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: I love these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a huge fan of fairies gear. I am a may thai practitioner and needed to get a solid pair of 12oz gloves. I am very satisfied with my purchase. Been using them for over a month now and they've been a great addition to my glove collection. Prompt shipment and fast delivery! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Venus A Smith

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I hoped for. I am 5'9", 170 lbs and use these gloves 3-4x a week at Muay Thai classes and heavy bag work. I bought the 14oz gloves. The gloves are well-constructed and very comfortable. I find the gloves a little loose if not using hand wraps. With wraps, they fit perfectly. Padding feels very good when hitting heavy bag. Only gave 4 stars for durability, because they haven't stood the test of time. But they feel like they will last.
customer_reviews.author: ryp44

customer_reviews.title: Very well made gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing gloves for cardio kickboxing, sparring, and hitting the heavy bag. Small surface to sneak in the guard but nice 16 oz. weight. Great flex in the palms for clinch, catching, and parrying punches. Always wipe down with cleaner and conditioning oils. Keeps the leather from breaking down. Gloves should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Royal Chapman bee's

customer_reviews.title: A well made professional glove for experts to beginners
customer_reviews.text: These gloves, are the best gloves I've owned and premium made, a professional feel to them. Much better then the cheap venum gloves, you can feel the difference right away, the inside padding the firm protection on the wrist and knuckles. These gloves don't feel like the cheaply made venum gloves my punching feels alot solid with these professionally made gloves from a a great company.
customer_reviews.author: Jaimee Barragan

customer_reviews.title: ... after several workouts The Thai Pride gloves have a great look and quality feel
customer_reviews.text: - Solid construction - Feel durable and high quality well after several workouts The Thai Pride gloves have a great look and quality feel. I have also used Title, Fighting, and Hayabusa gloves, and others. This pair feels like an all-round good pair of gloves
customer_reviews.author: (No Name)

customer_reviews.title: In all this is a great purchase if you’re looking for quality training gloves that ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for training on pads, the bag, and light sparring and I have to say they have gone beyond my expectations. They offer a lot of protection compared to the basic gloves I have had in the past. I’m striking harder but my hands aren’t feeling the reprecussions. The only issue I have is that the wrist support area is a little large for smaller build fighters. This can be fixed however by wrapping a little more by the wrist. In all this is a great purchase if you’re looking for quality training gloves that won’t break the bank!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha E.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the blue and they look super nice. These gloves have so much more ventilation ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are gorgeous as far as gloves can be gorgeous. I ordered the blue and they look super nice. These gloves have so much more ventilation than my old pair of Boxing gloves. They have a smaller profile compared to other gloves, looking like 14oz gloves when I have the 16oz gloves. Another guy in my Muah Thai group has them in black and he loves them too.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Premium Materials and Quality Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Fairtex are currently my favorite brand of glove. My last pair are going on their 2nd year of use, at least 4 days a week training muay thai and are still in great condition. Only reason for purchasing another pair is wanting a new color. These gloves are well made from premium materials/craftsmanship. You get what you pay for. As for the fit, when worn with wraps they fit pretty snug. I highly recommend these and if you do your research you will also find that fairtex is rated among the top for muay thai gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I got to use them for the first time last night and man they are awesome! Comfortable (and I have large hands), easy to get on and off, and fairly stylish (if you care about that sort of thing LOL). Highly recommend. Great gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Native Texan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality fairtex
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, I've had them for several months now, great product. Took them to thailand, work well in the humidity, they don't breathe as well in the hand, it could be nicer for rhem to have more ventilation. Gloves durability shows they can withstand allot.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a glove (Har har..)
customer_reviews.text: They fit great! I have small hands, but with handwraps the 14oz gloves are not super snug but not loose either (I'm really trying to avoid using "they fit like a glove", but they do). Even though it doesn't matter, I've gotten a lot of compliments from women ("those are cute!") to men ("nice Fairtex!"). It has a "made in Thailand" label and they're 1000x better than my old pink Elite ones. I can't say if they'll last long, but my instructor mentioned her Fairtex have lasted her for a couple of years and are still her favorite pair.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gloves and foam shape
customer_reviews.text: Best boxing gloves! I love that it’s not molded foam so when you hit the bag it has a nice flat contact with it and will not roll your wrists. Perfect gloves, I wished I found them earlier! Will get another heavier pair for sparring.
customer_reviews.author: Megen L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Heavybag
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I first tried them, but after wearing them for a while and also having borrowed other gloves (I often forget to bring my gloves to the gym) I can say the difference is night and day between these and most other gloves you can buy for $59. I use the 12oz mostly for the heavy bag and they feel incredible. Tight yet amply comfortable. Extremely protective and supportive of your fist. I could not recommend these any more. Also they smell good.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Quality is very good but the gloves are very small. Bought 16 oz version and they are small. My training partner has Anthems and Fairtex gloves are about 2-3 inches shorter. I don't have large palms and the gloves fit very snug probably too snug. Great quality but running on the small side. Wish I could return but used them once so I can't. March 6 Update. Wish I had bough the version with a grip bard maybe they would have better. If you have large hands, don't buy them (8 inch or greater knuckles) cause they'll be too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bielech

customer_reviews.title: Might be sticking with fairtex
customer_reviews.text: I train in kickboxing 5 times a week and I’ve owned about 5 different pairs of gloves. These are definitely the best of the bunch. Durable, great padding, and the finger grips on the inside of the gloves are excellent. There are 2 other brands I want to try out but I might just keep wearing the fairtex brand.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves, they got a workout at the last tournament. I was the only one in my club who had 16 oz. gloves. Everyone used them in their match. Not saying gloves did it, but we took 6 out of 8 matches.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Yogi

customer_reviews.title: small hand compartment
customer_reviews.text: Finish and glove quality is good but the hand compartment is way to small. I bought these for clinch days since my 16oz Fairtex are little big for those kind of days but they are way to small. My 16 oz gloves fit great with or without hand wraps, the 10 oz gloves are a bit of a struggle to get on without hand wraps. The plus side is my wife got a new pair of gloves and they fit her hands great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality gloves. The construction is solid, and the leather used on the glove is a high quality cowhide. I can't speak to how long they'll last, but I'm very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan S.

customer_reviews.title: missing wraps
customer_reviews.text: have not used yet however have used these gloves in the past,good support and material,a good glove for bag work and sparring.a good value. disappointed i did not receive wraps as indicated in product description
customer_reviews.author: mjpayo

customer_reviews.title: Great looking.
customer_reviews.text: These feel cheap but I am also used to Cletos Reyes so that may be the problem. I gave them four stars because other people at my gym say the feel decent. My sister uses them now and she can slip them on and off with unstrapping them. She does look sharp with them on though so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Gloves! Would give 6 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: Fit beautifully, feel great, look great, top notch, high quality, amazing!!! I don't think anyone could go wrong with these gloves, shoot, aside from feeling great, I like looking at them. I'm about 195 with moderate punching power. I hit a semi-hard 130-lb muay thai bag, have medium sized hands with long fingers, order the size 12 and the size is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: wingless bird

customer_reviews.title: Love my gloves! Fits great
customer_reviews.text: LOVE MY GLOVES...I'm in no way a professional...totally a beginner and was recommended this brand by a friends whose been taking Muy Thai classes for some time...she said this brand was extremely reliable and I def don't regret taking her advice. They are comfy and super sturdy...I have really small hands and I have no issues with them.
customer_reviews.author: JI SUN KIM

customer_reviews.title: Fits Tight
customer_reviews.text: You have to work them in a bit, but the gloves are amazing. My hands don't feel like ive been punching a brick wall after i finish my muay thai workouts. Highly recommend if your other gloves are leaving your hand swollen and broken.
customer_reviews.author: Isiaha A

customer_reviews.title: Yes, buy them.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the gold Falcon's. I love these gloves, of course, they're Fairtex. Shipped quickly, purchased from Muay Thai Faito, did not receive the box they come in, which is a bummer, but a great price, so I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: youtu.be/4yZ7mabx10E

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I Bought as a gift for my daughter - she loves them! She and Her husband picked them out but only buy the best. She loves the Pink color too. She’s been totally happy!
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves once past the break-in period
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with these gloves so far. The break-in period was pretty tough though. They come very stiff and the thumbs are practically flat so be prepared to be numb and have some roughed up knuckles the first week or 2. But that is the joy of breaking in new gloves, right? They don't cause me any trouble anymore and I have had them about 3 weeks. I will purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Landon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit!. Im a 6'2 guy, tall with large slim hands, I bought 16 Oz, the gloves have enough room to work with handwraps and from the oustside are very compact, no chunky at all. Well constructed, the feeling on the heavy just amazing. I've read comments about "breaking them in", I dont know, I feel them very good since day 1.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. They are much more compact than other gloves so the 14 oz gloves that I purchased are more like 12 oz gloves, but they are great nonetheless!
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Once you break them in they feel great and I have other boxing gloves that supposedly weigh ...
customer_reviews.text: I know how they would feel already and they met my expectations for sure. Once you break them in they feel great and I have other boxing gloves that supposedly weigh the same 14 ounce but for some reason these always feel lighter than others. good gloves especially for sparring
customer_reviews.author: skillz

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Solid glove, need broken in since they are stiff especially the thumb. No grip bar for people who prefer a grip bar (clinch purposes maybe?). Did not come with handwraps like advertised. I own the MTP brand and a pair of Yokkao. If you want something that feels broken in off the bat, Yokkao does that at a higher price point. I believe MTP fight gear is one of the best value for how cheap it is. (I think made in the same factory as Raja).
customer_reviews.author: Skeels

customer_reviews.title: I love these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves, a little bit pricy for training gloves but they are well made and not bulky, it’s exactly what I was looking for. Made out of leather so they will last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Authentic and trustworthy
customer_reviews.text: Fairtex has a long history of being reliable and these gloves are no exception. The padding is solid, the velcro strap in perfect condition and its made of authentic leather as well. One thing to note is that this model of Thai style gloves are less "pillowy" than other Thai glove models and have a more angular look and feel to it. This makes your punches feel sharper when you spar but it could feel weird to those who are used to/enjoy a more "pillowy" feel to their Thai gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Chen

customer_reviews.title: No more thumb and wrist pain
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because my Everlast gloves for Muay Thai and western boxing weren't cutting it. The biggest flaw with the Everlast gloves was having thumb and wrist pain no matter my technique. These feel great, snug with a little room, not too snug or too roomy. Will purchase again if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you also get handwraps
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Hayabusa t3 lx gloves and was looking for another glove to allow them to dry out. These Fairtex gloves are not quite the same padding and require you to make sure your knuckles are wrapped before putting them on. So far they have held up well and at half the price it is a decent second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymity

customer_reviews.title: ... for boxing and Muay Thai - 16 oz is perfect (so you can use for sparring) and they protect ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these for boxing and Muay Thai - 16 oz is perfect (so you can use for sparring) and they protect your hands. I train for an hour at a time and no fatigue and my hands feel great afterwards. Easy to get on and off. I would say one-size fits most, as my training partners use these gloves too and we're a range of weight classes. I just need to find better wraps, the fairtex ones get distorted too easily in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves, they’re a little more payed than other brands which makes them larger but other than that Tagore great!
customer_reviews.author: Omar Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves and customer service!
customer_reviews.text: The gloves seem to be great quality and look awesome! The seller, Price Fighter, had fantastic communication and helped to address my issues. I would definitely buy from them again. Note: These gloves seem to run a little large so be prepared for that. I got the 16 oz. ones. My partner also has 16 oz. gloves but the BGV1-BR version, the breathable kind. Those fit me perfect but these are larger. Not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: dcgoals

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: I put on these gloves, it isn’t the same and as other boxing gloves. It is so uncomfortable and it somehow hurts my wrist for some reason due to weird leather. It’s fake.....
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: I love my gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love my gloves. I get the patriotism compliments all the time :) They are comfortable. Only downside is that I am 5'2 and I have small hands and wrist. The gloves do not wrap tight enough around my wrist. But they have great padding. Good quality gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: these have GREAT QUALITY even down to the foam feel over the ...
customer_reviews.text: JUST GOT THESE IN THE MAIL. Just by the look of them I can tell they’re high quality compared to other gloves that just deteriorate. The stitching and foam contour looks well done and proportionate EVEN THOUGH THEY ARE HANDMADE, where as other gloves made with machine are aren’t, these have GREAT QUALITY even down to the foam feel over the knuckles. Definitely a re-buy when in time these wear down, I guess wait for my next purchase comment on the longevity...👌
customer_reviews.author: ALOHA PŌ

customer_reviews.title: No box as advertised but great gloves...
customer_reviews.text: I know that the box itself makes no difference in the quality of the glove, but the gloves I was buying were advertised with a cool looking box which I did not receive. Great gloves... but I still want my box! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Blank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent training gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for me for my 1 year anniversary of training in Muay Thai. They are nice and compact, not pillowy like 16 oz Twins gloves. I'm 6'2 with somewhat longish fingers and long arms and had concerns around them being too small when ordering, but the gloves feel great with wraps on. They felt nicely broken in after just one session. Couldn't be happier. The only downside seems to be how long they take to dry. Felt a little damp after airing out on the rack after 24 hours. May have to get special drying inserts for them. They're totally fine for light sparring with no headgear.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Norin

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are great. Top quality from Fairtex
customer_reviews.text: Gloves came very prompt. These gloves are great. Top quality from Fairtex, the leather and padding are excellent for Muay Thai work. They do take some time to break in. The limited edition design and color are awesome. Only negative is they came in sealed plastic but not the limited edition original box? Not sure why, but who keeps the box anyway. Would definitely recommend Fairtex gloves for Muay Thai
customer_reviews.author: Jimmyboy

customer_reviews.title: Top notch gloves worth the extra few bucks
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these gloves, I'm pretty new to Muay Thai only been training for a few months but these gloves are top notch quality. I'm heavier around 250 lbs so I ordered the 16 oz. Very nice leather plus excellent wrist support. Plus the red, white & blue just makes them even more awesome. They actually make matching hand wraps that I ordered as well. Shin Guards are next!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Andrew Mayer

customer_reviews.title: I always count on these
customer_reviews.text: I use these for pad work. They can be cleaned with vinegar/water solution (the sooner after your workout the better, and make sure to air dry fully). They'll last a while too, more than a year for sure. Very comfortable for medium sized hands like mine. Great quality and never had any stitching come undone.
customer_reviews.author: karl

customer_reviews.title: Tough and well balanced.
customer_reviews.text: Fit a bit snug but that's OK since I bought them to use as bag gloves and wear with out wraps. Otherwise they perform well and I expect them to last just like the 16oz gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Tiggermoon

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these on 3/31/2014, the estimated time of arrival was 4/23/2014 - 5/7/2014, however they arrived at 4/03/2014 and that is amazing. The make of the glove is wonderful, I can really work over the bag with these on without too much pressure being placed on my wrist. The Velcro so far is sturdy and the glove is snug even with 108' hand wraps on., the thumb placement is great, I was able to clinch with these on with some effort. I would recommend these to anyone who can spring for them, the are pricey, but to protect two of the eight limbs its well worth it. Buy them. Also USA USA USA!!!!
customer_reviews.author: a.Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and quality for bag work and sparring 4-5x ...
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and quality for bag work and sparring 4-5x a week on 150 lb bags. Definitely would recommend Fairtex
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: A perfect Muay Thai gloves for overall use
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't ask for a better pair of gloves. They feel so good on the hands, a bit stiff at first maybe but supposed to be "broken" after a while of use. Feels good both for sparring and bag work. A bit stiff, need to be used some time to be broken, and I believe they'll still have some stiffness left. An excellent pair!
customer_reviews.author: Guy Eshel

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, nice stitching and padding. Perfect for sparring. It was worth every penny investing into a good pair.
customer_reviews.author: illumi

customer_reviews.title: It’s the brand you want, if you’re serious about training.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the high quality material and how fast they came. The Velcro actually keeps the gloves on your hands while sparring and makes, it protects your thumbs very well, my hands aren’t sore after sparring or hitting the heavy bag, and I’ve been training super hard with them and they still look brand new! Fairtex is the brand you wanna go with if you’re gonna get serious about boxing, mma, Muay Thai, etc
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Fairtex is a premium brand in Combat Sports for many years. Real Leather, Hand-Made in Thailand!
customer_reviews.text: Fairtex is a premium brand in Combat Sports we have advised clients use for many years. Real Leather, Hand-Made in Thailand which will last longer than 10 years of weekly use when you clean the sweat after he use and use hand wraps.
customer_reviews.author: MaximFit

customer_reviews.title: Not the teal deal
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely no original fairtex gloves. I ordered 16 ounce gloves, which it says on it , but they feel cheap and more like 10-12 ounce gloves. I used to have a few good fairtex gloves. But having a family I started getting some cheaper gloves. Now I figured I’ll go back to what I used to have and this is what you get. Terrible
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and an awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and an awesome product! The gloves really shine, and the genuine leather holds up well. I use them 4-5x a week, and I couldn't be happier. Very breathable too.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a pair so finally bought one and I ain’t disappointed. Great quality gloves. I got the 10oz gloves. Perfect for my size (5’2). Highly recommend these gloves. Stretching is on point. Perfect amount of padding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 9/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: The lining in one of my gloves was loose when they arrived, hasn’t broken in around it in any way sense. That’s a distraction I don’t love. Fortunately, I love every other part to them. Fairtex is a leader for good reasons. Clinch and padwork feel great, shape feels natural and great for smashing. Would buy again, and always recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves
customer_reviews.text: Had it over a week, and I love it so far, excellent material. For us, females, the 12oz is just right, it looks small but very resistant and it fits perfectly. Really great for sparring and overall trainning. Im super satisfied with this purchase, the price is pretty decent, fairtex has the best "affordable" muay thai gloves, so go for it.
customer_reviews.author: CFA

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these gloves. Leather is firm, solid padding. Wrist straps are tight. I will never use anything other than fairtex gloves. They are Thai gloves, I would not recommend for boxers. The wrist cuffs are short for clinch work. Again, I ABSOLUTELY love these gloves. I have been using these gloves for 4 or 5 months before writing this review.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’3 and 130lbs. Bought the 14 oz gloves and they feel good. The material feels durable after a month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy fro
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if these gloves where a knock off or fake but they all did not hold up. Both pairs tore apart In the palm areas. This leads me to believe these were not real Fairtex gloves. I’ve had a pair before that lasted almost 4 years. These didn’t even last 3 months. Do not buy from this seller
customer_reviews.author: skyler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Durable, well made, top quality Thai glove. I don't think I'll ever buy another brand. Only downside is the lack of breathability which comes with the more solid construction of the glove. Just means it takes a little more focused cleaning if you want to keep them smelling fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Will Panuska

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves as a replacement to a pair that was way past their prime and could not be happier. I usually go kickboxing 5 to 6 times a week and these have held up great. I also love the pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Mariel Conway

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are great.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. At first they really hurt, but after a few uses, I broke them in. I love these gloves and I'd buy them over again.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita L.

customer_reviews.title: Yep
customer_reviews.text: Seemed a little tight at first, but after a few rounds seemed to loosen up.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Smith

customer_reviews.title: They are pretty stiff, but protect the hands well
customer_reviews.text: I use these for hitting the heavy bag. They are pretty stiff, but protect the hands well. I prefer Venom gloves, but these are nice
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Would buy these again!
customer_reviews.text: Fairtex is a good brand, I was not disappointed. These are great gloves and would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Dashia Lovvorn

customer_reviews.title: My god these feel good
customer_reviews.text: its like buying a nice guitar, you never really know the difference until you start getting better, for me these are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: daniel james

customer_reviews.title: Get These
customer_reviews.text: This is the choice of glove for about half of my Muay Thai gym. If you know what size you need, buy this with confidence. You typically buy gloves based on your own weight, but check with your coach first if they have a requirement. I know I'm a 16oz so I knew this would fit perfect and it's a quality glove.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: compared to Venum .and this is better . more Comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: First time using Fairtex gloves, heard it's small, but this is too small for 16 oz. It's like 12 oz gloves. Used it one time and returned it next day.
customer_reviews.author: Dai Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my boyfriend because he boxes and he likes them for practice
customer_reviews.author: Kaisha Glascoe

customer_reviews.title: I love Fairtex
customer_reviews.text: Good gloves. They get better once they start breaking in. I recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: TCT

customer_reviews.title: Fits Perfectly for Small Hands
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'1" and these gloves fit perfectly for my small hands. I've been using them on a 150 lb. heavy bag 4-5 times per week for less than a month and so far so good. The gloves are durable and beautifully made.
customer_reviews.author: S.J.

customer_reviews.title: Received defected item with tears
customer_reviews.text: Gloves have visible tears right out of the bag. For such mid-level pricing I would expect at least some kind of decent packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Best Muay Thai gloves I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Fairtex is the holy grail of Muay Thai gear, and these gloves look sick. Always getting compliments and the leather is still brand new after a year of abuse. Also these don't hold moisture and smell like my old Title gloves did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Fairtex Muay Thai Style Training Sparring Gloves
product_meta.description: These all-purpose training gloves are perfect for bag and pad work. The wraparound hook and loop wristband is easy to use and designed to provide a better fit for greater comfort and control. Evenly distributed padding protects your entire hand and creates a tight and compact design
feature_bullets: Ergonomically engineered with a unique contoured and tight-fit hand compartment designed to provide a secure and snug fit.
Constructed of premium leather with the Fairtex foam system for excellent hand and knuckle protection and shock disbursement.
Genuine leather gloves with velcro straps.
All-purpose boxing gloves and Tight fit design.
